001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.jdk.jul;
002
003import java.util.logging.Logger;
004
005import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig;
006import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties;
007import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperty.Property;
008import io.jstach.rainbowgum.spi.RainbowGumServiceProvider;
009import io.jstach.rainbowgum.spi.RainbowGumServiceProvider.Configurator;
010import io.jstach.svc.ServiceProvider;
011
012/**
013 * Will install the JUL handler if the <code>java.logging</code> module is available and
014 * is not alreadyi installed.
015 */
016@ServiceProvider(RainbowGumServiceProvider.class)
017public final class JULConfigurator implements Configurator, AutoCloseable {
018
019        /**
020         * If true will not install the JUL handler.
021         */
022        public static final String JUL_DISABLE_PROPERTY = "logging.jul.disable";
023
024        /**
025         * If true will not set the root loggers level to whatever the curreint rainbow gums
026         * global level default is.
027         */
028        public static final String JUL_LEVEL_DISABLE_PROPERTY = "logging.jul.level.disable";
029
030        static final Property<Boolean> JUL_DISABLE_PROPERTY_ = Property.builder()
031                .ofBoolean() //
032                .build(JUL_DISABLE_PROPERTY);
033
034        static final Property<Boolean> JUL_LEVEL_DISABLE_PROPERTY_ = Property.builder()
035                .ofBoolean() //
036                .build(JUL_LEVEL_DISABLE_PROPERTY);
037
038        private volatile boolean installed = false;
039
040        /**
041         * For service laoder.
042         */
043        public JULConfigurator() {
044        }
045
046        @Override
047        public boolean configure(@SuppressWarnings("exports") LogConfig config, @SuppressWarnings("exports") Pass pass) {
048                if (!install(config.properties())) {
049                        return true;
050                }
051                else {
052                        installed = true;
053                }
054                var disableLevel = JUL_LEVEL_DISABLE_PROPERTY_.get(config.properties()).value(false);
055
056                if (!disableLevel) {
057                        var logger = Logger.getLogger("");
058                        if (logger != null) {
059                                var systemLevel = traceToAll(config.levelResolver().resolveLevel(""));
060                                logger.setLevel(julLevel(systemLevel));
061                        }
062                }
063                return true;
064
065        }
066
067        private static System.Logger.Level traceToAll(System.Logger.Level level) {
068                if (level == System.Logger.Level.TRACE) {
069                        return System.Logger.Level.ALL;
070                }
071                return level;
072        }
073
074        /**
075         * Will install the JUL handler if not disabled by properties. This method is
076         * currently exposed for testing purposes.
077         * @param properties properties to check
078         * @return true if enabled.
079         * @hidden
080         */
081        public static boolean install(@SuppressWarnings("exports") LogProperties properties) {
082                if (JUL_DISABLE_PROPERTY_.get(properties).value(false)) {
083                        return false;
084                }
085                if (!isLoggingModuleAvailable()) {
086                        return false;
087                }
088                if (!SystemLoggerQueueJULHandler.isInstalled()) {
089                        SystemLoggerQueueJULHandler.install();
090                }
091                return true;
092
093        }
094
095        private static boolean isLoggingModuleAvailable() {
096                ModuleLayer bootLayer = ModuleLayer.boot();
097                return bootLayer.findModule("java.logging").isPresent();
098        }
099
100        /**
101         * Will test if already installed. This is mainly for testing purpsoes.
102         * @return true if installed.
103         * @hidden
104         */
105        public static boolean isInstalled() {
106                return SystemLoggerQueueJULHandler.isInstalled();
107        }
108
109        @Override
110        public void close() {
111                if (installed) {
112                        var logger = Logger.getLogger("");
113                        if (logger != null) {
114                                logger.setLevel(java.util.logging.Level.INFO);
115                        }
116                }
117
118        }
119
120        private java.util.logging.Level julLevel(System.Logger.Level level) {
121                var julLevel = switch (level) {
122                        case TRACE -> java.util.logging.Level.FINEST;
123                        case DEBUG -> java.util.logging.Level.FINE;
124                        case INFO -> java.util.logging.Level.INFO;
125                        case WARNING -> java.util.logging.Level.WARNING;
126                        case ERROR -> java.util.logging.Level.SEVERE;
127                        case ALL -> java.util.logging.Level.ALL;
128                        case OFF -> java.util.logging.Level.OFF;
129                };
130                return julLevel;
131        }
132
133}
